metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3006 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A known cache speculation vulnerability, known as Branch History Injection(BHI) or Spectre-BHB, becomes actual again for the new hw AmpereOne.Spectre-BHB is similar to Spectre v2, except that malicious code uses theshared branch history (stored in the CPU Branch History Buffer, or BHB) toinfluence mispredicted branches within the victim's hardware context. Oncethat occurs, speculation caused by the mispredicted branches can causecache allocation. This issue leads to obtaining information that should notbe accessible.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-169.187~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-169.187~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-169.187~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-generic - 5.4.0-169.187~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-152-lowlatency - 5.4.0-169.187~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1104-aws - 5.4.0-1116.126~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1110-azure - 5.4.0-1121.128~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1107-gcp - 5.4.0-1120.129~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1063.68~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1103-oracle - 5.4.0-1115.124~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-1088-raspi - 5.4.0-1100.112~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
